tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Diane Martel
programme.desc: From Mariah Carey to Ol Dirty Bastard, Kelis, Eve, Snoop Dogg and more, rage lines up clips directed by the late Diane Martel.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: "Why are we so fixated on looking good?" Artist Ramesh Mario Nithiyendran seeks answers from photographer William Yang, model and mentor Elaine George, artist Joan Ross and choreographer Kelly Abbey.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the body of a missing trawler man is pulled from the sea, DCI Vera Stanhope must delve into the lives of his family in a close knit fishing community.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a young popstar is found dead at a rehab clinic, it initially looks like a tragic accident. But Neville is convinced theres more to her death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The Settlers
programme.desc: In the occupied territory of the West Bank is a growing ultra-nationalist community of Israeli settlers. Louis meets prominent settlers and discovers the consequences of their activity - and their plans to move into Gaza.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: In Featherston, Swedish architect Josefine Watterson tackles the challenge of creating a Passive House for her young family in pursuit of both a more sustainable lifestyle and a prestigious qualification.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis rescues some sick-looking indoor plants, Jane Edmanson discovers the many benefits of salvias, Millie Ross shows how to keep worms happy, and we meet our new guest presenter, permaculturist Hannah Maloney.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: Death In Paradise: Christmas Special
programme.desc: The sun-soaked, scintillating beauty of Saint Marie is rocked by a baffling murder at Christmas time, with a dazzling array of guest stars under suspicion.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a woman reports a murder and is then found strangled, the team are left wondering whether she was reporting her own murder.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths visits the Burma-Thailand Railway that has become synonymous with WWII Prisoners of War. But a dusty piano in storage at the Australian War Memorial reveals something she could never have imagined.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug and Cat Noir face Lila, who now becomes Chameleon. She can take on the appearance of anyone and is determined to destroy Ladybug.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A friend of Marinettes gets akumatized into Truth. Using his power to force people to tell the truth, he wants to know Marinettes secret... and Ladybug and Cat Noirs, too!

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: When a beautiful dress arrives at Malory Towers, the girls are buzzing to realise there is a debutante in their midst, but who is it?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun is in serious trouble when the Farmer discovers hes the cake thief whos sabotaged his baked goods. When another farmer arrives and begins negotiations with the Farmer, Shaun fears the worst.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Newsflash just in... a super gross stink has been detected coming from the vicinity of the Doctors lab. The hunt is on for grossest thing on Operation Ouch!...ever!

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: This instalment of the Crystal Maze sees DJ Melvin Odoom captain comedian All Murray, actor Kara Tointon, reality TV stalwart Olivia Attwood and actor Ashley Taylor-Dawson through the ubiquitous 4 zones.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug faces her own grandfather. Now Bakerix, he wants to destroy everything he deems too modern and go back to the Paris he used to know.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Juleka becomes Reflekta again. But this time, the supervillain isnt alone... and Marinette and Adrien are having trouble with their Miraculous. Will our heroes manage to stop Reflekta and her fearsome ally?

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A famous comedian gets akumatised into Psycomedian. Able to impose any emotions on anyone, he wants to wipe the smiles off everyones faces...starting with Ladybug and Cat Noir!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang come face to face with the ghost of Abraham Lincoln.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Blossom wants to impress a famous scientist.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock are delighted when a bird watcher drops his duck call in their field and Shaun uses it to entertain them. However, swallowing the duck call isnt what he had in mind - and the ducks arent too happy either.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Blast off! Dr Chris boards a weightless flight and Dr Xand meets an astronaut to explore what happens to the human body in space. How do you sneeze, poo and wee in zero gravity?

programme.title: Super Shark Highway
programme.desc: The Northern research team head to Orpheus Island, a nursery ground for baby blacktip reef sharks. Known for forming social networks, scientists want to uncover how young blacktips learn social and survival skills.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand look at why your body needs iron in todays DO try this at home experiment.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews...
programme.desc: Louis Theroux heads to the seaside town of Herne Bay to spend time with actor, director and former rapper Ashley Walters at his family home. (Final)

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Andrew, a new kid at Hartley who has muscular dystrophy, is determined to fit in

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintroll waits for his best friend to arrive to the valley, but he has to be patient as Snufkin takes his time.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: A villain sets off a backwards bubble that causes everyone at headquarters to move backwards.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Nom Nom recruits the Bears to act as his entourage of friends. But when the Bears realise Nom Nom doesnt understand friendship, they decide to kick their day of bonding into high gear.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Pinkie Pie visits Prince Rutherford and the Yaks. While there an avalanche falls on the entire rustic village of Yakyakistan. Pinkie Pie suggests that she go to get the other ponies to come help.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven thinks his favorite ice cream sandwiches are the trick to summoning his magic shield but learns otherwise when facing off with an acid-spewing insect monster.

programme.title: George Clarkes Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Paul and Imogen snapped up a collection of abandoned buildings, including a pub, butchers and bakery. With ambitious plans to restore the Grade II listed building, there are long delays and eye-watering costs.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Alexandra, Artem, Anthony Dempsey and Rune Carlsen.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.sub-title: Ask Me No Questions, Ill Tell You No Lies
programme.desc: Section D are back, tracking a Somalian terrorist on a boat carrying a lethal load. The team suspect the felon and his cargo are bound for Plymouth - just in time for launch of the new Royal Navy vessel.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Nina Las Vegas
programme.desc: Join Nina Las Vegas as she guest programs rage, celebrating ten years of NLV Records with a playlist of boundary-pushing club sounds and everything in-between.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Priscilla, Queen Of The Desert
programme.desc: Resplendent in flamboyant ball gowns, three drag performers brave the Australian outback in their battered tour bus.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.sub-title: Its A Wonderful Life Piper Part 1
programme.desc: Piper learns what life would be like if she never joined The Next Step and discovers how many lives shes touched through the years.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.sub-title: The Last Dragon In The World
programme.desc: Moomintroll finds a real dragon in the river, just the right size to be a pet and all he wants is for the little dragon to love him back.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A bored Shaun dresses up as the Farmer to entertain the flock. Realising he now has the power to boss Bitzer around Shaun takes the opportunity to throw a bit of a party for the flock.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Its just a normal game of capture the flag...except the flag is a skull, and your opponents are armed with fire hoses, toilet plunger harpoons and giant rolling boulders...which is nothing like capture the flag.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: To survive in a city inhabited by bugs, the Bears become noir-style detectives.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: The Gems go on a mission to place a Moon Goddess statue on top of the ruined Lunar Sea Spire. Meanwhile, with the help of a novelty cheeseburger backpack, Steven tries to prove that he can be useful.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phils near Huddersfield, where Jeans eccentric house layout is matched only by her taste in decor. And in Queensbury Yorkshire, Phils racing to help retired teacher Mary, whos country cottage has lost its country charm.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: When Maggie reveals that shes been keeping a $30,000 nest egg "for a rainy day", she becomes a target to her own conniving kids, not to mention the endless other scammers preying on Australias elderly.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai causes problems when he attempts to program droids to clean the temple.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Queen Thistle decides to take a day off, so Holly, Ben, Nanny and the King have to look after the naughty twins Daisy and Poppy for the day. But even all the Elves in the Little Kingdom cant help them stay out of trouble.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are watching a man flying his model aeroplane, and watch it coming and going as it flies overhead.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel wants to play a game with Mum Tiger outside, hes upset that she is giving Margaret all of her attention.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bings sleeping at Sulas but has forgotten Hoppity! A scratchy branch terrifies Bing, whos not comforted by Sulas Fairy Rhino! Sula, Nicky and Bing play Nicky tickles as they wait for Flop.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is International Day at playgroup and Peppa and her friends have dressed up as countries of the world.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington does not have a hobby; the Browns all seem to be good at something, buts hes not. Mrs Brown finds out what Paddington is good at in the end.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Three baby ladybirds, Amber, Emerald and Keith have come to stay at their uncle Gastons for the day. The baby ladybirds are exhausting! So Ben and Holly help Gaston to keep them entertained.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are on the search for a new home but after all the house viewings, nothing beats their home. Peppa then suggests they extend their house instead, so the family design a bigger house together.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma cant wait to explore on Snorkelling Day, but her snorkel gets in the way. Frizzy is being distracting while the cadets learn how to stay calm in the water, but in the end, its Frizzy who teaches Gemma how to relax.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Its been one year since Cosima crash-landed on Proxima, but no one else has remembered this anniversary! Can a perfect picnic jolt their memories?

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Rise and shine, its time for breakfast! Leah and Matt are joined by cook and food educator Alice Zaslavsky for a brilliant breakfast of zucchini fritters and homemade granola with yoghurt and blueberries.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups take a trip to space for a cheesy bite to eat. The orders pile up for the Lucky Loover Bird chef, will the Mixmups have the patience to wait for their food or will they have to find another way to hurry things up?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is busy building a tower as tall as he is with his blocks and is upset when Coco arrives and hijacks the blocks so that she can make a rainbow pattern with them instead.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: With only five minutes to play Driving, Bluey and Mum race against the clock to buy milk for a grumpy guest and have to escape an angry shopkeeper.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Find out how Mister Maker creates waves on an Australian beach, cooks up a tasty surprise - with a twist - in the UK, and see whether he can make sensational Spoon Maracas in under a minute on a trip to South Africa!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: While repairing a sea wall, Sandy and Carly accidentally cut off a consortium of crabs from the shore! When the crabs start to wreak havoc among the farm animals, Carly and Sandy work together to wrangle the crabs.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is World Book Day at playgroup but Peppa has so many favourite books she just cannot decide which to go as.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes search for honeysuckles, leaving behind a trail of berries to help find their way back. But when Wasabi eats the trail, theyre stranded in the dark!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its an epic game of "Find the Flag" - and the winner gets to open the mystery box of presents that Drew and Jonathans mom brought back from her business trip.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: While exploring a dark and spooky cave, the Octonauts discover the fossil of a powerful, prehistoric fish... but it may be more than just a fossil.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Pioneers work on Annies farm, but Sarah accidentally lets the sheep go loose. They knock over Annies stove which starts a fire.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is in Sydney city, taking in the amazing sights and the majestic ibis! Michelle and Kaeng build an underground train to help people get around, and Michelle sings and dances with Kaeng the busker!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy go on a trip to the childrens festival where there is singing, making crafts and listening to stories. They stay overnight in a tent, though it looks like its going to rain.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: A strange find far away from the ship breaks D.O.R.I.S.s sat nav. Luckily, Big Lizards on hand to teach Cosima how to find her way around without technology.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owlette accidentally helps Pirate Robot attack the Flying factory.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee introduces the squirrels to his friend Eugene, the leader of the Big Parade. Poor Eugene has lost his hat. Dont worry Eugene, the squirrels will find you a new hat in their dressing up box.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Carrot are in a race to find treasure before Captain Pak Choi does

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nash and the young Jedi pursue stolen jellyfruit.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum takes the Fairy children for a Nature Class in the woods, and bumps into the Wise Old Elf who is teaching a Nature Class to the Elf children.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch some children untie balloons, which fly up high. Great BigHoo unties all the balloons and he, Toodloo, Chickedy and Chick fly up and up into the sky.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is very excited, because Prince Tuesday is home visiting from college! But, Prince Wednesday is upset that Daniel is paying more attention to his big brother than to him.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are painting in the garden. Bing accidentally knocks the water over and tries to refill it, but he turns it on too fast and the hose turns into a big snake, covering them in wet paint!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is raining outside so Peppa and George have to stay indoors. While they wait for the rain to stop, Daddy Pig teaches them a fun game.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington gets his arm stuck in a post box after accidentally using Mr Grubers rare Penny Black on his letter to Aunt Lucy.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The bath tap at the Little Castle is dripping, so the elf plumber is called. Its a bigger job than first expected, but with King and Queen Marigolds coming around, theres not much time to get it looking tip-top.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: During the renovation of Peppas home, they find out the construction crew used the robot house blueprint Peppa and George made! Thankfully, Peppa finds the original design to re-build the house into their perfect new home!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce, Frizzy and Gemma each have their own personal superstar lifeguard hero. But during an action-packed ride-along day, they discover that its not about the individual, but the team.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When D.O.R.I.S. reveals a large meteor is about to land on the spaceship its finally time to leave. But should Big Lizard leave too? What about all those who need him on Proxima?

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Its lunch time for Miah and Takaya! To help build a delicious lunch box, Indigenous Chef Mark Olive shows Miah and Takaya how to bake a Warrigal Greens slice using amazing native ingredients.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups dream of living in a perfect fairy tale castle but when they dont succeed, will they find "another way" to find a castle thats suitable for everyone?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula go to the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing quietly and giving the ducks just the right amount of food.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Tired of being told what to do, Bluey and Bingo enlist their giant invisible friend to show Mum and Dad whos boss. Now they can do anything they want, until Mum and Dad rebel.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Join Mister Maker, Scrappz and Tocky in Australia as we discover how to make a joke lolly, in the UK we find the Mini Makers creating a treasure trove, and in South Africa we make a lovely lizard from boring bubble wrap.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Sir Topham Hatt gets an overconfident new track car named Winston to drive him around, Thomas has to find a way to get this "new" guy to listen, find his way around Sodor, and get Sir Topham Hatt to a big event on time.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family sleep overnight in a tent and wake up to find the festival is covered in mud. Luckily Miss Rabbit is prepared with lots of muddy activities.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Its the great Sunday Roast, the day when the Potatodons hides are extra hot, crispy and delicious!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Juno struggles to be a patient patient while she waits for Vida to remove her cast.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts journey across a dangerous expanse of ice to help a penguin mother get back to her family.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Mike hears eerie singing and glowing lights in the sea near the lighthouse, he calls Agent Price and Agent Sparkes to check it out.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo visits the Great Barrier Reef, learning about sea turtles, sharks and rays! Matt and Miah go riding on a surfboard and boogie board, and Kiya and Joey explore the wonders of the six Noongar seasons!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa and Granny Pig have been growing strawberries to make jam but when they discover that the birds have eaten them all, they go to a strawberry farm.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard frustrates Dad by stealing a strange plant from the ship. A disaster is averted when Big Lizard persuades Dad theres more to this plant than meets the eye. And nose...

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets build the Grand Crabby Hotel to protect rock pool sea creatures from the seagulls, but soon learn that despite being tough they shouldnt be moved.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: With Motsukis help, the moths infiltrate HQ and Gekko wont admit that he let them in until it is too late.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day and everyone is outside enjoying themselves in the sunshine. Everything is peaceful until Naughty Monkey starts throwing banana skins down from his branch. Ethel slips and lands with a very big bump.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea makes her car voice controlled, but it gets cross when she isnt nice to it.

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Diane Martel
programme.desc: From Mariah Carey to Ol Dirty Bastard, Kelis, Eve, Snoop Dogg and more, rage lines up clips directed by the late Diane Martel.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: Death In Paradise: Christmas Special
programme.desc: The sun-soaked, scintillating beauty of Saint Marie is rocked by a baffling murder at Christmas time, with a dazzling array of guest stars under suspicion.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a woman reports a murder and is then found strangled, the team are left wondering whether she was reporting her own murder.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths visits the Burma-Thailand Railway that has become synonymous with WWII Prisoners of War. But a dusty piano in storage at the Australian War Memorial reveals something she could never have imagined.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: BTN: Teen Social Media Ban Special
programme.desc: Australia is about to become the first country in the world to ban social media for kids under 16. In this BTN Special, kids question PM Anthony Albanese about the ban and we ask teens what they think.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.desc: The voice of summer, ABC cricket commentator Jim Maxwell reflects on his six favourite Ashes moments, starting with the incident between Jonny Bairstow and Alex Carey at Lords in 2023 when Bairstow was stumped.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Its been 50 years since the dismissal of the Whitlam government. We look back at why it happened and how its still influencing Australian politics today.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Melissa Mackay brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Melissa Mackay brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Disconnected: The Teen Social Media Ban
programme.desc: As Australia begins to restrict access for under 16s to social media platforms, we ask teens and experts about the move being closely watched by big tech giants, platforms and countries grappling with the use of data.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: More than 1400 people killed in extreme flooding and landslides across Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Thailand, plus a look at why China is planning to hike prices on contraceptives.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: The last word from economists ahead of the final interest rate decision for 2025. The latest inflation and wages data has markets and economists tipping rates will remain on hold well into 2026. Could the next move be up?

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Live: Interest Rate Decision
programme.desc: The RBA deliver their final interest rates decision for 2025, with inflation and economic data indicating no further rate cuts are imminent. Ros Childs, Alicia Barry and David Taylor bring you reaction and analysis.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.desc: Tech bros are racing to develop the first mass-produced humanoid. But despite investing billions of dollars, these robots require a great deal of human intervention. So, why has creating a humanoid proven so difficult?

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.
